TYNESIDE UNIVERSITIES SOCIETIES

Next month the London Stock Exchange is heading to South Shields and Newcastle as part of the ‚ÄòScaleUp Britain‚Äô campaign with‚Ä¶
data.text:
Congratulations, Norman Grant Jr, founder of Four Corners Coalition for being selected as one of the top 7 out of a record-high 105 pitch competition entries into the Athene Black & Brown Business Summit Pitch Competition and representing our inclusive entrepreneurial ecosystem on a national stage. üì∫ If you are curious about listening to the live pitches or the educational programming, records of the live broadcast may be available for a short time here: https://lnkd.in/ghynhZKn üéì And if you are a small business owner thinking about going back to school with all the flexible, online, and asynchronous options available these days to complete your studies while running your business, Bank of America would like to help. They used this summit to announce a new Supplier Diversity Small and Diverse Business Scholarship Program with 30 x $10K in scholarships specifically for various types of underrepresented entrepreneurs. Submission deadline is May 23, 2024. More info here: https://lnkd.in/g29EcBag We have been 4 for 4 since this pitch competition started. Round 1 call for online submissions will likely be due end of Jan 2025. Can't wait to see who steps into the bright lights to represent us in 2025! #BBBS2024, #IncludiveEntrepreneurialEcosystem #ScholarshipsAndCompetitions

As the demand for international education increases, investing in or owning an international school offers unparalleled opportunities. In one of our recent blog posts, Jacques Rossouw, CFA, CIPM dives into the numerous benefits of owning or investing in international schools. Discover how steady enrolment, high tuition fees, transformative educational impacts, and prime real estate opportunities can make this a highly rewarding venture. Whether you are an investor, landowner, or entrepreneur, Premiera can guide you in every step of the way to ensure your investment not only yields financial returns but also creates a lasting impact on communities and future generations. Click here to read the full blog: https://lnkd.in/df-TyDru #InternationalSchool #Benefits #SchoolOwner #InternationalSchoolInvestment #Opportunity #Education #Blogpost #PremieraEducationGroup #Premiera

Trying to stay up to speed! üèÉ‚ôÇÔ∏è Two weeks ago we joined the Stanford LBAN/Latino Business Action Network for a night of drinks and new connections in Orlando, FL. #Spoiler: I'm not an LBAN Alumni, but Yolanda Lassalle, BSChE, LSSMBB, co-founder of Murmuratto and CEO of LaSalle Group, LLC Group, was actually part of the first-ever Stanford LBAN cohort back in 2015. According to Forbes magazine (2022), data from Crunchbase shows that Latino entrepreneurs receive only 2 percent of U.S. venture capital investments, despite making up nearly half of the net new small business growth between 2007 and 2017. üï∞ There are many leaders and funds stepping up to bridge this gap. While this happens though, many Latino entrepreneurs continue to launch businesses in a broad range of industries including F&B, Retail, Law, Consulting, and tech - to name a few. It was rewarding to meet scores of #leaders who have built great, successful businesses despite the gap in access to funding. Thanks LBAN! These events are a testament to the power of diversity in driving innovation. Let's keep it up! #StanfordLBAN #LatinoFounders #DiversityInTech

üì∞ A lovely midweek read for all our Cambridge colleagues and connections ‚Äì Teri F. Willey recalls her five year tenure as founding director of Cambridge Enterprise. Tony Quested asks the questions, and there are some really interesting stories from way back in 2006, when Cambridge Enterprise was created as part of Cambridge University to improve knowledge transfer and research impact. The organisation, heading towards its 20th year, is responsible for facilitating and using the incredibly high-quality of the University research to "create globally leading economic and social impact". Take a few minutes and read the background to this Cambridge institution in its own right, that is now deeply embedded in the country's innovation and entrepreneurial ecosystem. A few takeaway phrases from us: ‚Äì "How did you go about putting your successful model in place? Listening, and asking a lot of questions to a lot of people and listening some more." ‚Äì "We typically had equity in around 80 companies at any one time while I was there and under Geraldine‚Äôs leadership worked with each one to see how we could support their success." ‚Äì "we learned we had not communicated well enough that we were there for the University of Cambridge: a limited company, limited by shares with only one share holder: The University of Cambridge. We needed to show and communicate that we were not ‚Äúother‚Äù." Thanks for sharing, both. #Cambridge Business Weekly newspaper

Excited to share that the Financial Times has once again published a letter authored by our General Partner, Ekaterina Almasque! In a recent article, FT reported a decline in funding for UK university spinouts, marking the first decrease in a decade. Yet, the article didn‚Äôt explore the factors hindering these spinouts from achieving global competitiveness. Katya‚Äôs letter highlights the following critical challenges faced by UK university spinouts: üìäEquity retention disparities compared to European and US counterparts. üéìThe deterrent effect of excessive university control on potential investors ü§ùThe critical role of VC firms in bridging academia and business. The key message here is clear: It‚Äôs not just about the level of funding but removing the barriers that impede their progress and harnessing their true potential. Read the entire letter from the link in the comments below.‚¨áÔ∏è #venturecapital #universityspinouts
